data.title: PopCap Games

data.text:
This page only shows primary logo variants.

For other related logos and images, see:

Other

2000 2000–2003 2003–2007 2007–2013 2011–present

Sexy Action Cool[]

2000[]

Designer: Jason Kapalka

Typography: Godzilla

Faktos

Launched: 2000

This was used only on the company's first title, "Foxy Poker".

PopCap Games[]

2000–2003[]

Designer: Jason Kapalka

Typography: Deftone Stylus

Launched: 2000

In its original logo, the PopCap Games logo featured the words "Pop" and "Cap" in yellow circle with a red border. At the right side of it is the word "GAMES", also in red text.

2003–2013[]

2003–2007[]

Designer: Unknown

Typography: Deftone Stylus

Launched: 2003

In 2003, the logo was metallicized, its background was changed from yellow to light blue, and the word "GAMES" was moved to the circle. The circle in this logo was also used in the 2007 logo from July 2007 to January 12, 2021.

2007–2013[]

Designer: Mark Simonson

Typography: Deftone Stylus (modified)

Launched: July 2007

In July 2007, the longest-lived logo of the company was introduced where the "PopCap" wordmark or text was modified. The cursive line of an "O" connecting to the second "P" is between them instead of within the "O", above portion of the first "P" is straight, letters are now rounded and the word "GAMES" was removed from the logo, leaving the "PopCap" text behind. From July 2007 to January 2016, it used a metallicized round circle with a light blue background from the 2003–2007 logo. Like with the previous logos, this logo is used on its games and is notably used on Plants vs. Zombies franchise since its start or inception on April 1, 2009 upon the release of "Zombies on Your Lawn" music video on YouTube.

2011–present[]

Designer: Unknown

Typography: Deftone Stylus (modified)

Launched: April 2011

In April 2011, the logo became horizontal and the circle was permanently removed. It was concurrently used with the 2007 logo until June 2013.

[]
